subject: Photography
title: Computational Photography Explained
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Computational Photography Explained.

hook.text: Your phone takes twelve photos when you press the shutter once. Software picks the best parts of each.

buildup.text: Computational photography uses algorithms to combine data from multiple exposures into a single superior image.

discovery.text: HDR, night mode, and portrait blur are all computational â€” the camera's software does work the lens cannot.

twist.text: The 'photo' you see was never a single moment. It's a composite of multiple instants merged by machine learning.

climax.text: Computational photography redefines what a photograph is. It's less a record and more a reconstruction.

punchline.text: Your phone doesn't take photos. It computes them.

quiz.question: What does computational photography fundamentally do?
options: Combines data from multiple exposures using algorithms to create one image
